alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:21PM MDT until April 15 at 5:15AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Beaver Creek near Hinsdale affecting Valley County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Beaver Creek...including Hinsdale...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Beaver Creek near Hinsdale. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, flood stage...river is at or near bankfull at this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM MDT Tuesday was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 16.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.7 feet on 05/13/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
